intro: Ornithidium montezumae, commonly known as the Mexican feather grass, is a member of the Poaceae family, characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. It is native to Mexico and is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are arranged in spikelets, typical of many grass species. Its foliage is often used in traditional landscaping due to its ornamental appeal and low maintenance requirements. Ornithidium montezumae plays a minor role in local ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various insect species.
